header.title: Megaco MIB

chapter.p:
The Megaco MIB is not yet standardized and our implementation is based on
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-megaco-mib-04.txt. Almost all of the MIB cannot easily be implemented by the Megaco application. Instead these things are to implemented by a user (of the Megaco application).
So, what part of the MIB is implemented? Basically the relevant statistic counters of the MedGwyGatewayStatsEntry.

section.title: Statistics Counters
section.p: The implementation of the statistic counters is lightweight. That is, the statistic counters are handled separately by different entities of the application. For example, our two transport modules, megaco_tcp and megaco_udp, maintain their own counters and the application engine, megaco maintains its own counters.
This also means that if users implement their own transport services, they need to maintain their own statistics.

section.title: Distribution
section.p: Each Megaco application maintains its own set of counters. In a large (distributed) MG/MGC it can therefore be necessary to collect the statistics from several nodes (each) running the Megaco application (only one of them with the transport).
